item.title: Tepary bean genomes added to LIS
item.description: Phaseolus acutifolius (tepary bean) is a drought- and heat-tolerant crop native to the American Southwest and Mexico; it joins the growing set of annotated genomes at LIS, with a cultivated and wild accession described in Moghaddam et al. 2021. The cultivated accession has been added as the primary representative of the species, and can be found via the standard gene search pages, and genome browsers, while the wild species is accessible via a Phaseolus data source for the GCV instance located here, which also includes several new accessions of Phaseolus vulgaris (UI111 and LaborOvalle), courtesy of Phytozome.

item.title: Bringing Macrosynteny to the GCV Multi-view
item.description: The Genomic Context Viewer (GCV) is a web application that provides interactive and synchronized comparative genomics visualizations. Comparisons are performed by determining conservation of gene order and orientation across related species or individuals using homology based on gene family assignments….

item.title: So, What is Jekyll?
item.description:
Jekyll is a tool for transforming your plain text into static websites and blogs. It is simple, static, and blog-aware. Jekyll uses the Liquid templating language and has builtin Markdown and Textile support.

It also ties in really really nicely to Github Pages.

Learn more about Jekyll on their website.
